question: The drug of choice in digitalis induced ventricular arrhythmias is:
reasoning_chain: CHAIN: "Digitalis induced ventricular arrhythmias" -> "increased ventricular excitability" -> "I.V. Lignocaine administration" -> "stabilization of cardiac membrane" -> "reduction in arrhythmias" -> 85%
CHAIN: "Digitalis induced ventricular arrhythmias" -> "altered ion transport in heart cells" -> "Phenytoin administration" -> "normalization of ion transport" -> "decrease in arrhythmias" -> 80%

CHAIN: "Digitalis induced ventricular arrhythmias" -> "enhanced automaticity and reentry circuits" -> "Quinidine administration" -> "possible worsening of arrhythmias due to increased QT interval" -> "unclear effectiveness" -> 40%

CHAIN: "Digitalis induced ventricular arrhythmias" -> "disruption in electrical conduction" -> "Procainamide administration" -> "possible reduction in arrhythmias" -> "risk of QT prolongation and arrhythmia exacerbation" -> 50%
enhanced_information: I.V. Lignocaine is the preferred treatment for digitalis-induced ventricular arrhythmias due to its ability to stabilize cardiac membranes and reduce excitability without significant QT prolongation. Phenytoin serves as a possible alternative with similar ion channel stabilizing effects. Quinidine and Procainamide, although effective for other arrhythmias, pose risks of QT prolongation and are less suitable for digitalis-induced conditions.
analysis: I.V. Lignocaine is the drug of choice for digitalis-induced ventricular arrhythmias due to its effective cardiac membrane stabilization and minimal impact on the QT interval, aligning with both standard medical consensus and enhanced information provided.
